newsitem.title: USA: Plains feedlot cattle not trading - feedlots.
newsitem.headline: Plains feedlot cattle not trading - feedlots.

text.p: U.S. Plains direct cattle markets near midday Wednesday remained quiet, with no sales of slaughter steers or heifers reported, feedlot sources said.
Packer bids were reported at $70.00 per cwt but cattle owners continued to ask a solid $72.00, with a few at $73.00.
The $72.00 bid matched the bulk of last week's moderate sales, they said.

"They (packers) know its going to take $72.00 to $73.00 to buy cattle, but I don't think it will happen until Thursday, unless someone wants to jump ahead of the crowd," one Panhandle feedlot operator said.
